intro: Alansmia semilunaris, commonly known as the moonflower alansmia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale pink flowers that open at night. The plant produces small, round berries that are edible but often have a bitter taste. Alansmia semilunaris thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its unique blooming pattern and medicinal properties make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
